intro: Phyllorkis retusiuscula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
